intro: Erigeron minusculus, commonly known as the small fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies, meadows, and disturbed soils. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron minusculus is often found in dry, rocky areas and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
